ojc.bain.synapse

Class Graupner2012SynapseCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • ojc.bain.base.ComponentCollection
        • ojc.bain.base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • ojc.bain.base.SynapseCollection<Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration>
            • ojc.bain.synapse.Graupner2012SynapseCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ComponentConfigurationListener

    public class Graupner2012SynapseCollection
extends SynapseCollection<Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration>
    Implementation of the model described by Graupner, M., Brunel, N.: Calcium-Based Plasticity Model Explains Sensitivity of Synaptic Changes to Spike Pattern, Rate, and Dendritic Location. PNAS. 109, 3991â€“3996 (2012). (using the simplified calcium model). NOTE: the noise component of this model is not implemented.
    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman
    See Also:
    Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class SynapseCollection<Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration>

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Resets all synapses to their initial state. Sub-classes should override this method if state variables other than the efficacy and synapseOutputs must be reset, or if they should be set to something other than 0. The overriding method should invoke this super-method (before doing anything else). Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        reset in class SynapseCollection<Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration>

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Implements the basic infrastructure for processing a synapse by updating the values of SynapseCollection.synapseOutputs and SynapseCollection.neuronInputs. Sub-classes must override this method and call the super-method after they have updated SynapseCollection.efficacy.
        Overrides:
        run in class SynapseCollection<Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration>

      • getStateVariableNames

        public java.lang.String[] getStateVariableNames()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Get an array containing the names of all the internal state variables. Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes.
        Overrides:
        getStateVariableNames in class ComponentCollection

      • getStateVariableValues

        public double[] getStateVariableValues(int synapseIndex)
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Get an array containing the values of all the internal state variables, in the same order as that given by getStateVariableNames(). Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes. The overriding method should ensure the state variables are up to date by invoking ComponentCollection.ensureStateVariablesAreFresh().
        Overrides:
        getStateVariableValues in class ComponentCollection

      • getConfigSingleton

        public ComponentConfiguration getConfigSingleton()
        Description copied from class: ConfigurableComponentCollection
        Get a reference to the sub-class specific ComponentConfiguration object for this ConfigurableComponentCollection.
        Specified by:
        getConfigSingleton in class ConfigurableComponentCollection<Graupner2012SynapseConfiguration>

      • ensureStateVariablesAreFresh

        public void ensureStateVariablesAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensure the state variable values have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale.
        Specified by:
        ensureStateVariablesAreFresh in class ComponentCollection
